newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: South Korea's President Kim to visit Malaysia.
newsitem.headline: South Korea's President Kim to visit Malaysia.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young Sam will visit Malaysia later this month to improve bilateral ties, Seoul's ambassador to Kuala Lumpur was quoted as saying on Tuesday.

Kim's three-day visit from November 26 comes after a number of joint ventures have been proposed between Malaysia and South Korea in the shipbuilding, cement manufacturing and electronics industries, Jhung Kyung-yil was quoted saying by Malaysia's Bernama news agency.
Jhung told a news conference in Kuala Lumpur that South Korea is the fifth largest foreign investor in Malaysia and the country's 10th largest trading partner.
Five South Korean companies had this year alone invested almost $700 million to set up manufacturing plants for steel pipes, televisions and commercial vehicles in Malaysia, he said.
Bilateral trade totalled $5.5 billion last year.
